page.title: 11Life in the Country
page.content: Our farm is called New Barn farm. It is a mixed type farm. We have about 150 pheasants for breeding, the babies are out in the Autumn. There are groups of woods dotted about. It is very quiet and hardly anything goes on. The roads are very narrow. We live in an old school house next to the church. The church is full of bats in the belfry and the vestry. I sleep in a room which was added on to the old school, it has a polished wooden floor. There was one big school room, all the other rooms were teachers' rooms. We have two open fireplaces. There is a well in the dining room and one outside and a toilet in the garden. There are many stray cats from the woods.
